Thank you, but this doesn't seem to work for me... although I updated Toolbar and AFBW, the game crashes on me if I press the button on the Toolbar, and shift+L doesn't do anything

I had a similar experience in Windows 7, it would crash whenever I tried to open it from the toolbar regardless of whether I had a joystick plugged in or not.

This was with 1.0.2 and the updated dll from Taniwha. Since no one else had reported this I figured it was something weird with my hardware. Fortunately I play mostly on Linux.

I tried to look into why it was crashing, but I'm not that experienced with Unity or Windows programming. It looked like it was crashing in Xinput code enumerating my controllers. I put my output_log.txt in dropbox if anyone with more Unity/Windows experience wants to take a look at it.

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/25219148/output_log.txt

Working well for me in 1.04, using a thrustmaster warthog and saitek pedals. A couple of things I've noticed:

- I can't seem to set any controller button for physics timewarp + and -. Or rather, the setting is saved in the AFBW config window, but the button does not actually cause physics timewarp to occur. Same for show/hide navball.

- If I use the thrustmaster TARGET software to fix things like sensitivity for the throttle nipple axes, then AFBW can no longer see all of the buttons (it can see most, but not all -switches don't seem to function) unless I turn them into keypresses, but that has a few issues - it runs the risk of messing up the AFBW GUI if I accidentally press the wrong button in config, plus it's a pain to organise everything in multiple places, and if I'm using keypress assignment in target then I might as well just use stock input setup. But if I don't use TARGET then controlling the camera becomes impossible because of the crazy sensitivity on the camera (this is not a mod problem, it's an issue with the hardware, the nipple works fine in DCS which is what it was designed for, but goes crazy in anything else.

Edited August 12, 2015 by allmhuran

I have a strange issue here with the mod refusing to detect my joysticks. I'm running Gentoo linux 64bit. The stock game detects the joysticks, and they work in other software, but this mod lists only Keyboard+Mouse controller. I'm using KSP 1.0.4 (both 32 and 64 bit version show same behaviour) and latest AFBW with the patched dll from taniwha.

Is there yet to be a fix for the x-55 HOTAS for windows 8.1. I've been here a few times before reading if therse a fix or not but cant seem to find it/any! Is there help to get or am i doomed and have to wait for a new update or even mod!
A little help pls? I have never used a mod before! I DL'd the CKAN installer but don't find this Mod? Where do I put the command line Please?

Just installed and works fine on Windows 7 with a Logitech 3d extreme. Not sure why other people are having problems. I don't know if it's because of hardware/software issues or if they didn't follow the instructions in the OP. This is not a standard mod install. You must read the OP, follow the instructions and use the updated dll provided by Taniwha.
Not on CKAN at the moment... maybe because it shows only for .90 of KSP?
Windows 10 with the latest version of KSP and CKAN won't let me install it says its incompatible please help.
Install it manually, and grab the updated dll from a couple of pages back.
I'm trying to use this mod and it isn't working with my SNES PC controller. The option for it doesn't appear anywhere... Help?
Is mod still supported? Would really like it to work with version 1.0.5

It does work with 1.0.5 linux. I expect it'll work on windows but I haven't tested it. You'll need to get the old version from KerbalStuff and replace the DLL with the version from Taniwha's Github page. Note the manual install instructions on page 1 of this thread. Good luck!
Works fine on Windows 1.05 with a T.16000

After a pretty long break, version 1.6 for KSP 1.0.5 is available. It may take a bit for CKAN to index it but after that you should be good to go. Linux version has also been updated.

Thanks to taniwha for his fixes.

Also just encountered this problem, but only since updating to the 1.0.5 version of AFBW.

My mechjeb has no issues with directional control, only with thrust.
Solved this by making an extra preset called "Mechjeb" that only has throttle control disabled from my (X55) throttle joystick. Just using a hotkey to swap in between makes it a painless temp sollution.
